item.title: Cat that has been run over, 7th October
item.description:
There is a cat that has been horribly run over near Hoveton Road bus stop SW. Itâ€™s very distressing to see especially for kids that might be on their way to the school nearby in the morning
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crossway, Thamesmead, London

item.title: Westminster College Paddington Campus Littering, 7th October
item.description:
The public area near the Berkeley building (Westmarktower and surroundings) is regularly littered and unhygienic due to students from Westminster College. They habitually leave opened food packaging, spill food in the bushes, and frequently trespass into the private gardens of the Berkeley building. The lack of accountability and enforcement is concerning, particularly as these facilities and activities are funded by taxpayers. There seems to be little or no action by the council or college to address the repeated destruction and wastage occurring in these communal spaces.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newcastle Place, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Confusing traffic light system, 7th October
item.description:
Turning right from Bellenden road onto Peckham High Street there is an immediate paedistrian crossing. This has a posed a safety issue as once you are allowed to turn right onto the high street, some cars cross the red light of the paedistrian crossing to avoid holding up traffic in the box junction. The paedistrian crossing traffic light need to be in sync with the traffic lights used to control joining traffic from bellenden road. At the moment cars are forced to run a red light and it is unsafe for paedistrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellenden Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Open air dump by bus stop on Woolwich New Road / SE18 6UX, 7th October
item.description:
I would like to report excessive litter dumping in the area surrounding this bus stop on Woolwich New Road. This corner has effectively become an open-air dump, with litter sometimes overflowing onto the street, sidewalks and even onto our estate, Trinity Walk. I contacted Pinnacle, the company that manages our estate, but they have stated that this area falls under the councilâ€™s responsibility. The volume of rubbish is concerning and does not seem environmentally healthy. I would appreciate your help to make this a nice area to live in. Could you please look into this matter and advise on what action can be taken to address the litter? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich New Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 5th report for this flytip - NO IT IS NOT RESOLVED, 7th October
item.description:

item.title: Car abandoned in the middle of the road, 7th October
item.description:
Car is abandoned in the middle of the road creating a backlog of cars when driving. Car itself looks fine but windows are down and passenger side wheel is sticking out. I drive this route daily and it was not there Sunday evening (5/10/2025) but was there Monday morning (6/10/2025) it is still there this evening (7/10/2025)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolacombe Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The flags are back, 7th October
item.description:
Multiple flags and bunting on the Horse roundabout again. As before, causing obstruction to views in all directions for traffic. This is going to cause an accident before long. Also, there is now graffiti on the flags that some woudl consider offensive. Something really needs to be done about this moving forward as these flags are a public nuisance and someone will get hurt on this busy roundabout.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet
